CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Senior Care Group relative to Wellness Program Participants?
SRP.A: Senior Care Group is {below} Wellness Program Participants in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Pediatric Patients relative to Chronic Condition Patients?
SRP.A: Pediatric Patients is {below} Chronic Condition Patients in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Emergency Room Patients relative to Outpatient Visitors?
SRP.A: Emergency Room Patients is {below} Outpatient Visitors in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total patient satisfaction?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Outpatient Visitors}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total patient satisfaction?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Chronic Condition Patients}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Chronic Condition Patients's maximum Patient Satisfaction in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Chronic Condition Patients's maximum Patient Satisfaction is in {1990}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Pediatric Patients's minimum Patient Satisfaction in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Pediatric Patients's minimum Patient Satisfaction is in {1989}.

NC.Q: Was the total Patient Satisfaction in 2004 higher or lower than in 2005?
NC.A: The total patient satisfaction in 2004 was {lower} than in 2005.

NC.Q: Between 1999 and 2000, did the total Patient Satisfaction experience a larger or smaller change than between 1990 and 1999?
NC.A: The change in total patient satisfaction between 1999 and 2000 was {smaller} than between 1990 and 1999.

NC.Q: Was the total Patient Satisfaction in 1993 higher or lower than in 2001?
NC.A: The total patient satisfaction in 1993 was {lower} than in 2001.

NC.Q: Was the total Patient Satisfaction in 1993 higher or lower than in 2006?
NC.A: The total patient satisfaction in 1993 was {higher} than in 2006.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Emergency Room Patients} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Wellness Program Participants and Outpatient Visitors first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Wellness Program Participants and Outpatient Visitors first exchanged leading positions in {1990}.
